item.title: Cropped Remote Desktop fullscreen mode in macOS
item.dc:creator: Oliver Gut
item.description: When adding a new Remote Desktop connection using the official Microsoft Mac App Store Remote Desktop app on my MacBook, the default value for full screen mode is to use all available monitors. This results in a few pixels missing on top of the screen. Disabling this option will fix this issue.
item.content:encoded: When adding a new Remote Desktop connection using the official Microsoft Mac App Store Remote Desktop app on my MacBook, the default value for full screen mode is to use all available monitors. This results in a few pixels missing on top of the screen. Disabling this option will fix this issue.
